resources.string: No device found! \n Tap the top right plus icon to add device

SwitchBot needs to access your location to provide you features like SwitchBot device automation, accessing WLAN and Bluetooth lists and finding devices nearby. SwitchBot will not track or store your location information.
Please enable Bluetooth in system settings

Please enable the permission of access to \'Location\' in your phone settings, this is a mandatory permission to access Bluetooth after Android 6.0. We promise never to collect any personal information.
This device is encrypted, please enter the password.
Password should be at least 4 bytes
A Hub is needed for Bluetooth devices to use Scene, and please enable cloud service.
Add device page route path error
Tap the Bot icon to turn it ON/OFF. Then select the Bot to be added and tap next.
Failed to upload Duplicated name. Try a new one.
Are you sure you want to remove this device(s) from your account?
Are you sure you want to delete this device?
Error Message: Your password and the confirmation password do not match.
Please note that only ASCII characters are allowed for password, while invisible characters are invalid (e.g. spaces)

Note: Under this mode, the battery may drain much faster and the plastic arm may wear out much faster. As a beta function, the delay timer between each action can be set up to an hour. There may be a minor time error, which becomes larger as the timer increases. Additionally, do not press the On/Off button before the series of delay actions are completed. Tap "Clear current action" to clear the actions if you want to resume to active control.
Long press the button on the top of the device for 3 seconds until the indicator light starts flashing. Then tap the Next button.
This device is already connected to the internet. Tap skip to pass this step.
Sorry, SSID containing space is not supported currently.

You are about to migrate your device to another Home. If you are moving devices pysically to a new place, please remember to reconfigure Wi-Fi network information. Once moved, Scenes associated with this device will fail to function.

You are about to migrate your device to another Home. All infrared remote control devices associated with your Hub will also be moved. Once moved, any devices associated with cloud services via your Hub will not be able to continue using cloud service functions.

You are about to migrate your device to another Home. If you need to use cloud services with this device, you will need to set up a Hub inside your new Home. You must then manually change your Hub ID inside your cloud service settings on your device Settings page. Once moved, Scenes associated with your device will fail to function.
Want to change the password? Please note that if this device has been paired to a Remote, you need to pair them again after changing password to sync data.
Are you ready for mode switching? Please note if this device has been paired to a Remote before, you need to repair to sync data.
Pin to Top and Add Device
Please note that the maximum number of timers supported is 5
1. When the indoor cam is on or after reset, the indicator light will light up.\n2. You will hear a prompt tone when it is booted up, the indicator light will flash red.\n3. Proceed to the next step
You may set a certain point as the preset point and move to match that position during scene automation. For example, when contact sensor is triggered, the camera will rotate towards the door.
This may take around 25 seconds, do you wish to continue?
No scene name, please enter a scene name.
Move the Pan/Tilt Cam to your desired direction. Click save to set it as a preset point.

1. When the Pan/Tilt Cam is turned on or after reset, the indicator light will light up.\n2. You will hear a prompt tone when it is booted up, the indicator light will flash red.\n3. Proceed to the next step.
Connect the power to a 5V2A AC adapter.
Use the reset pin to press the reset button on the Pan/Tilt cam for about 5 seconds until you hear a prompt tone.
You will hear a prompt tone when it is booted up, the indicator light will start to flash red.
3. Make sure the lens is not blocked and faces the QR code directly, try several times by adjusting the angle and distance.
Connecting Pan/Tilt Cam to your Wi-Fi network, please do not turn off the power.

▪ You may have entered the wrong Wi-Fi password.\n▪ Pan/Tilt Cam can only support 2.4GHz Wi-Fi network.\n▪ Unstable network connection. Place Pan/Tilt Cam and your phone as close to the router as possible.
This device has already been added to someone else\'s account. For security reasons, please ask the previous owner to remove this device from their account and retry.
Plug in the power. Make sure the USB cable is connected to a 5V1A AC adapter.
Press and hold the reset button on the back of indoor cam for 5 seconds until you hear the prompt tone.
You will hear a prompt tone when it is booted up. The indicator light will start flashing red.
Hold your phone and show the QR code about 10 to 20 cm away from your camera.
When you hear a prompt tone, tap I heard the prompt tone.
I didn\'t hear any prompt tone

Your Wi-Fi name or password is too long. Indoor Cam may fail to recognize the QR code generated from your Wi-Fi info. It is recommended to go to your router settings and reduce the length of your Wi-Fi SSID or password.
This device has already been added to someone else\'s account. For security reasons, please ask the previous owner to remove this device from his/her account first. Then try adding it again.
If you need assitance, tap “Feedback” to get in touch with us.
Drag or resize the red frame to set an activity area
Are you sure you want to format the MicroSD card?
I didn\'t hear any prompt tone
You have devices with firmware that has failed to update. Please navigate to Profile > Firmware Recovery to fix.
1. Please make sure the red indicator light is flashing.
2. Set your phone\'s brightness to its maximum and make sure that it is brighter than the surrounding environment.

▪ You may have entered the wrong Wi-Fi password. \n▪ Indoor cam can only support 2.4GHz Wi-Fi network. \n▪ Unstable network connection. Place indoor cam and your phone as close to the router as possible.
Tap Try Again to start over. \nTap View FAQs to navigate to our support page for more solutions.
Connecting Indoor Cam to your Wi-Fi network, please do not power it off...
You have successfully added the device!\nTap \"Start to use\" to start using it.
The MicroSD card inserted can\'t be read. Please navigate to storage settings and format it.
You must format the MicroSD card to use it.
Long press the button for 2 seconds until the LED light starts flashing. Then tap the Next button.
The Curtain\'s position had been changed and the settings are unavailable now. Please delete this device.
This device is not calibrated. Please tap Calibration to calibrate first.
If you choose "Open from middle", you need two Curtains. Do you want to continue?
Please press the buttons below to move your Curtain to the fully opened position following the direction in the animation above
Please press the buttons below to move your Curtain to the fully closed position following the direction in the animation above
Move Left - Curtain moves continously to the left end\nMove Right - Curtain moves continously to the right end\nPause - Curtain pauses right away
Please press the buttons below to move your Curtain to the fully opened and fully closed position one more time
You are about to leave the calibration process and calibration data during this session will be lost. Are you sure?
You are about to set Curtain %s and the Curtain above as a group device. The Curtain above will become a secondary device of Curtain %s and will not show up on the home page until it is ungrouped.
If you have a Curtain that has not been added, please tap the plus button to add it.

The actual placement of the two Curtains may be different from what you see below. Tap any of the Curtain icons below to trigger a slight movement of the chosen Curtain. Tap the double arrow button to swap their position.
U Rail Type Curtain Installation Guide
I Rail Type Curtain Installation Guide
U Rail/I Rail Type Curtain Uninstallation Guide
There are a few versions of Curtain (Rod), please check the version you purchased according to the pictures.

Long press the button for 15 seconds until the LED light stays on. Then release the button. If you are opening curtain from middle, please delete the grouped curtain device from the app home page and then add it back.
1. Please fully close your curtain and then detach the end curtain hook from the track.

2. Following the diagram, attach the Curtain's main body and the other Hook to the curtain track between the first and the second curtain clip. Then rotate them by 90° facing each other and attach the other Hook back to the main body.
Notice:
- The SwitchBot LOGO should face your room.
- If a Hook is attached to the main body, you can detach it by pushing down the Hook clip and detach it from the main body.
3. Put the curtain back in place so the Curtain is hidden.
1. Please fully close your curtain and then detach the end curtain hook from the track.

2. Take one Hook (I Rail). Push the Hook Button down and hold. Then attach the Hook onto the curtain rail. When both of the Hook Wheels are aligned with the rail, release the Hook Button so that they are firmly attached.

3. Take the Main Body with the other Hook (I Rail) installed. Push the Hook Button down and hold. Then attach the Hook onto the curtain rail. When both of the Hook Wheels are aligned with the rail, release the Hook Button so that they are firmly attached. The SwitchBot LOGO should face your room.
4. Pull the single Hook down and attach it back to the Main Body.
5. Put the curtain back in place so the Curtain is hidden.
Fully close your curtain then detach the end curtain hook from the track.
Try attach the separate Hook onto your curtain track and check if it fits or not.
Note:\nIf the pair of Hook Wheels do not match, please take them off.

Attach both of Curtain\'s Main Body (with one Hook attached) and the separate Hook onto the curtain track, pull the separate Hook downwards slightly, and attach it back to the Main Body. The SwitchBot logo should face your room.
Finish by putting Curtain behind your curtain so that it is hidden.
If the current group is dismissed, Curtain %s and %s will be shown on the home page and you will have to redo the calibration for both devices. Are you sure?
You are about to redo the calibration. Existing calibration data will be cleared immediately. Do you want to continue?
Hint: Drag the chart left and right to view more data

The Data Source has been changed. 
Possible causes,
1.Solar Panel got disconnected
2. Another user modified it or the current user modified it on another platform
1. Charging with Solar Panel requires the illuminance to reach at least level 6\n2. Charging with an adapter requires a 5V 1A AC adapter
When the Top Lid is connected to the Hook Arms, press down and hold the Button and slide the Top Lid up to the top position of the Hook Arms.
Hold the Main Body with both of your hands and place your thumbs against the Hook Arm Switches. Press the switches down and slowly push them up until the switches slide into the gaps.
Grab the Clips provided in the box.
Attach a Clip on the first tab.
Attach Clips on every other tab.

All other Clips should be attached the opposite way against the first Clip. Make sure all Clips are sitting on the top of the rod and are aligned with each other. From the second Clip, the tail of one Clip should be able to touch the head of the next Clip.
Place the Curtain onto the rod between the first and the second tab behind the panel.
Compress the space between the Top Lid and the Motor as much as you can.
The Hook Arm Switches will skip off by themselves when the Top Lid and the Motor are firmly attached to the rod. Conceal them into the slots.
Installation complete. The Curtain should be hidden behind the panel.
When the Top Lid is connected to the Hook Arms, press down and hold the Button and slide the Top Lid up to the top position of the Hook Arms.
Hold the Main Body with both of your hands and place your thumbs against the Hook Arm Switches. Press the switches down and slowly push them up until the switches slide into the gaps.
Grab the Clips provided in the box.
Attach a Clip on the first tab.
Attach Clips on every other tab.

All other Clips should be attached the opposite way against the first Clip. Make sure all Clips are sitting on the top of the rod and are aligned with each other. From the second Clip, the tail of one Clip should be able to touch the head of the next Clip.
Place the Curtain onto the rod between the first and the second tab behind the panel.
Compress the space between the Top Lid and the Motor as much as you can.
The Hook Arm Switches will skip off by themselves when the Top Lid and the Motor are firmly attached to the rod. Conceal them into the slots.
Installation complete. The Curtain should be hidden behind the panel.
This is an alternative method for Grommet Curtains when regular method does not work well. It requires more Clips and a special plastic Strip which can be purchased from us.
When the Top Lid is connected to the Hook Arms, press down and hold the Button and slide the Top Lid up to the top position of the Hook Arms.
Hold the Main Body with both of your hands and place your thumbs against the Hook Arm Switches. Press the switches down and slowly push them up until the switches slide into the gaps.
Close the curtain and make sure the distances between each fold line are approximately equal.
Straigthen the Strip and align the first hole with one outer fold line. Count the number of holes between two outer fold lines and take note of this number.
You need to determine how many Clips you need. Count the number of inner fold lines on the curtain panel. You need one Clip on each inner fold line.
Grab the Clips provided in the box.
Attach a Clip to the end of the Strip. Insert the gap on the Strip into the Clip head and flip it over.

In previous steps, you have counted the number of holes between two outer fold lines. Use this number to determine the next position on the Strip that you are to attach a Clip. Attach all the Clips on the Strip.
Install one Clip onto every inner fold line of the curtain panel. Keep the Strip straightened when you install the Clips.
When you install all the Clips onto the curtain, try open and close it and make sure the Strip is straightened when closed. You can cut the rest of the Strip off or hide it behind the curtain.
Place the Curtain onto the rod between the first and the second tab behind the panel.
Compress the space between the Top Lid and the Motor as much as you can.
The Hook Arm Switches will skip off by themselves when the Top Lid and the Motor are firmly attached to the rod. Conceal them into the slots.
Installation complete. The Curtain should be hidden behind the panel.
When the Top Lid is connected to the Hook Arms, press down and hold the Button and slide the Top Lid up to the top position of the Hook Arms.
Hold the Main Body with both of your hands and place your thumbs against the Hook Arm Switches. Press the switches down and slowly push them up until the switches slide into the gaps.
Close the curtain. Then place the Curtain onto the rod between the first and the second ring behind the panel.
Compress the space between the Top Lid and the Motor as much as you can.
The Hook Arm Switches will skip off by themselves when the Top Lid and the Motor are firmly attached to the rod. Conceal them into the slots.
Installation complete. The Curtain should be hidden behind the panel.
When the Top Lid is connected to the Hook Arms, press down and hold the Button and slide the Top Lid up to the top position of the Hook Arms.
Hold the Main Body with both of your hands and place your thumbs against the Hook Arm Switches. Press the switches down and slowly push them up until the switches slide into the gaps.
Close the curtain. Then place the Curtain onto the rod between the first and the second grommet behind the panel.
Compress the space between the Top Lid and the Motor as much as you can.
The Hook Arm Switches will skip off by themselves when the Top Lid and the Motor are firmly attached to the rod. Conceal them into the slots.
Installation complete. The Curtain should be hidden behind the panel.
If you are using an extendable curtain rod, Curtain may not move smoothly or even get stuck at the joining point of the rod during calibration.
Before you move on, please make sure you draw your curtain to the thicker end of the rod. And you must install Curtain on the thicker end of the rod as well.
Compress the space between the Top Lid and the Motor using both of your hands until Curtain is firmly attached. (Warning: over-compressing may break the Hook.)

If Curtain cannot move smoothly on the rod or it gets stuck at the connecting point during calibration, we have provided a Rod Connector to help fix the problems. Rod Connector is a flexible aluminum plate covered with a tape that is used to smoothen the slope between two connecting rods. Please follow these steps to install.
Move Curtain to the thicker end of the rod, preferably a few centimeters away from the connecting point.
Remove the adhesive protection cloth from Rod Connector.
Stick one end of Rod Connector to the curtain rod, as shown in the graph.
Wrap Rod Connector around the rod slowly while applying pressure to each segment of the metal plate against the thinner end of the rod.
Rod Connector should be firmly adhered to the connecting section of the rod.
If you change the data source of illuminance, the existing Curtain actions may be affected. Are you sure?

Selecting Silent Mode reduces the noise level when Curtain is moving. As a tradeoff, Curtain will move at a lower speed and there might be conditions that it cannot open/close the curtain. Are you sure?
1. Make sure your curtain is fully closed, detach the first roller of the closing direction.
2. Insert the separate Hook into the curtain rail and rotate it by 90º. Pull the Hook towards one side of the rail and tilt it back and forth to double check it fits inside the rail perfectly.
If the rollers do not match, please use the appropriate rollers provided.
No suitable rollers? Please contact us at: support@wondertechlabs.com

3. Insert both SwitchBot Curtain\'s main body (with one Hook attached) and the separate Hook into the curtain rail simultaneously, rotate them by 90°, then instantly attach the separate Hook back to the main body. The SwitchBot logo should face your room.
4. Put the curtain back in place so SwitchBot Curtain is hidden.Congratulations! You have completed the installation.
1. Remove the rollers from the hook.
(Use the parts for a simpler installation)
2. Grab a hook wheel with the desired size. Adjust the white wheels until you can see the metal bar. Insert the metal bar into the tip of the hook. You should hear a click once it is firmly attached.
3. Replace the hook wheel for the other hook by repeating the previous steps.
If your curtain rail is one of the below, please visit the following site for more support:
Troubleshooting For Curtain After Setting Up
In case the pair of Hook Wheels do not match, detach them from the Hook and try again. If this method still does not work, please contact our customer support at support@wondertechlabs.com.
Install SwitchBot Curtain at the back of your curtain.
Pull one side of the detached Hooks and attach it between the first and second grommet.
Put the main body (attached with the other Hook) onto the rod, pull down the Hook and install it on the main body, you will hear a click when it is firmly installed.
Adjust the position of the SwitchBot Curtain to keep it perpendicular to the ground, make sure the logo faces indoor.

" Refer to the pictures above, install the beads fixer at the top of the grommet (with beads installed in it), make sure that you clip it on the grommet firmly. Finish by cutting the remaining beads or put it behind your curtain. "
Close your curtain and remove the first hook from it.
Pull one side of the detached Hooks and attach it between the first and second ring onto your curtain rod.
Put the main body (attached with the other Hook) onto the rod, pull down the Hook and install it on the main body, you will hear a click when it is firmly installed.
Finish by adjusting the position of the SwitchBot Curtain to keep it perpendicular to the ground, make sure the logo faces indoor. Put SwitchBot Curtain behind your curtain.
Install SwitchBot Curtain according to the picture using the clips provided.
Close the curtain, attach a clip on the first tab.
Attach the remaining clips on other tabs as shown on the picture.
Beware that all other clips should be attached the opposite way against the first clip, make sure all the clips are sitting on the top of the rod and are aligned with each other.
Install SwitchBot Curtain at the back of your curtain.
Pull one side of the detached Hooks and attach it between the first and second ring onto your curtain rod.
Put the main body (attached with the other Hook) onto the rod, pull down the Hook and install it on the main body, you will hear a click when it is firmly installed.
Finish by adjusting the position of the SwitchBot Curtain to keep it perpendicular to the ground, make sure the logo faces indoor.
Install SwitchBot Curtain according to the picture using the clips provided.
Close your curtain, attach a clip on the first tab.
Attach the remaining clips on other tabs as shown on the picture.
Beware that all other clips should be attached the opposite way against the first clip, make sure all the clips are sitting on the top of the rod and are aligned with each other.
Install SwitchBot Curtain at the back of your curtain.
Pull one side of the detached Hooks and attach it between the first and second ring onto your curtain rod.
Put the main body (attached with the other Hook) onto the rod, pull down the Hook and install it on the main body, you will hear a click when it is firmly installed.
Finish by adjusting the position of the SwitchBot Curtain to keep it perpendicular to the ground, make sure the logo faces indoor.
Hold the button on the back of the device until the Bluetooth logo flashes on its screen. Then tap Next.
Are you sure you want to delete?

First, you will need an accurate reference for temperature and humidity values. Temperature and humidity need to be calibrated separately and you can choose to calibrate only one or both of them as necessary. Accuracy of the original Meter can be found in the manual.\n\nCalibration is only intended to correct small variations (typically just several degrees or around 5% RH). If you\'re seeing a bigger discrepancy than that while calibrating, please go to Profile->Feedback to contact us or reach support@wondertechlabs.com for more assistance, as that would indicate that there\'s a problem with either the calibration process or your Meter. We\'ll be happy to help you sort it out.

Method A:
Ice water makes a great temperature reference. Just mix up a bowl of ice water, with a good even mixture of ice and water. Give it a good stir and let it sit while you seal your SwitchBot Meter in a zip-top baggie. Get as much air out of the bag as possible. Place the SwitchBot Meter (inside the baggie) into the ice water mixture. It's best to leave the zip-top out of the water, just in case it doesn't seal entirely.
Give the SwitchBot Meter at least 30 minutes to acclimate, be sure you have an updated reading and then adjust the calibration controls so the value reads exactly 32.0°F (0.0°C)

If you have any difficulties, consider these tips:
1. Make sure that when you run the test that you remove as much air from the bag as possible.
2. Make sure the side of the Meter with the writing on it is facing into the water.
3. Make sure the Meter is as submerged as much as possible because of the plastic case, the battery and the other components that need to be brought to equilibrium.

Method B:
If you have a trusted thermometer that you know to be very accurate, you can use it as a reference. Simply place it next to the SwitchBot Meter in a stable environment, let them sit for at least 30 minutes to acclimate to each other, be sure you have an updated reading and then use the calibration controls (shown below) to adjust the SwitchBot Meter to match the reference.

"Method A:
For calibrating humidity, the "salt test" is quite popular, and instructions can be found readily on the Internet. The chemical principle is sound and it can work quite well, but we find it to be difficult to execute consistently and accurately.

Method B:
Calibrating to an inaccurate reference can be worse than not calibrating at all, so we prefer the Boveda One–Step Hygrometer Calibration Kit, available for less than $10 on Amazon.

Just open the baggie, seal your SwitchBot Meter inside and place it at room temperature in a location with minimal temperature variations. Let it sit undisturbed for at least 24–36 hours, be sure you have an updated reading and then adjust the calibration controls to read exactly 75.0% humidity. Keep the calibration kit sealed and you can use it multiple times for at least 3 months after the initial test.

Method C:
If you have a trusted hygrometer that you know to be very accurate, you can use it as a reference. Simply place it next to the SwitchBot Meter in a stable environment, let them sit for at least 30 minutes to acclimate to each other, be sure you have an updated reading and then use the calibration controls (shown below) to adjust the SwitchBot Meter to match the reference."
Keep Turned on in Standby Mode

On the back of SwitchBot Hub, please switch to AUTO and switch back to ON. Then tap Next below.
Use the switch on the back to set light mode.
The color has been pushed to your cloud :)
After deletion, devices in this room can be found in "All devices".
The Cloud Service Settings is inconsistent on the device. Scenes related to this device may not triggered properly. Please disable Cloud Service for this device and enable it again.
Long press the button on the top of the device for 2 seconds until the indicator light starts flashing. Then tap the Next button.
This automation will be deleted. Are you sure?

Automation only supports smart devices within the Bluetooth connection range of Motion sensor, which cannot be switched remotely through the network. If you need to switch smart devices remotely, please enable Cloud Service on Motion Sensor and ensure that both Motion Sensor and the device controlled by Motion Sensor can be connected to a Hub device.
A Hub device is found near Motion Sensor. Do you want to enable Cloud Service on it?
A Hub device is found near Contact Sensor. Do you want to enable Cloud Service on it?
After you enable the indicator light, Motion Sensor will flash briefly when motion is detected.
A Hub device is found near Motion Sensor. Its current firmware version does not support Motion Sensor. You need to update the firmware in order to enable Cloud Service on Motion Sensor.

Automation only supports smart devices within the Bluetooth connection range of Contact Sensor, which cannot be switched remotely through the network. If you need to switch smart devices remotely, please enable Cloud Service on Contact Sensor and ensure that both Contact Sensor and the device controlled by Contact Sensor can be connected to a Hub device.
Are you sure you want to remove this Motion Sensor from your device list?

This function is to adjust the brightness boundary of the ambient light detected by the device. You can set the specified brightness boundary on this page, Which lower than this brightness is dim and higher than this brightness is bright.\n\nPlease confirm that the location of the device is no longer moving, and adjust the environment light around device to a dim environment, then click the confirm button.
Confirm the current ambient brightness is dim
Cannot save the Ambient Brightness settings because it is too bright. Please lower the brightness in your room.
You can choose a sensitivity level that best meets your needs. Follow these steps.
1. Choose a sensitivity level, e.g. Medium
2. Walk a few meters away to where you want motion to be detected
4. If the image on the app turns from Out or range to Within detection range and the indicator light of the device turns on, the current sensitivity level is good.
Note: The precision of motion sensitivity can be affected by room temperature. The Reference Distance is derived from lab experiments conducted under 77°F (25°C).
Avoid placing Motion Sensor behind a door or facing a window. Keep it away from any heat sources such as heater, Wi-Fi router, or lamp.
Do you have a pet in your home?
If you are a pet owner, the way to install Motion Sensor is slightly different.
This is how you normally install Motion Sensor, where the Reset Button is facing up. The detection range is shown in the picture above.
Install Motion Sensor without the Base
Install Motion Sensor with the Base
1. Place Motion Sensor directly on a table or shelf, or
2. Stick it to a flat surface using the 3M Sticker.
1. Mount the Base to the back or the bottom of Motion Sensor.
2. Either stick the Base to a flat surface using the tape OR attach it to an iron surface directly.
The Base can be attached to an iron surface or a magnet.
Two ways to install with the Base
To prevent false alarms due to pet movement, install Motion Sensor to a spot 0.3~0.7ft higher than your pet and lower than your chest. Tap next to continue.
Turn Motion Sensor around so that the Reset Button is facing down. The detection range is also flipped.
Peel & Lightly place on a closed door

Placing Contact Sensor on the door allows it to sense the motion of the door opening. Make sure the installation area is clean and dust free. Attach it 5 ft to 5 ft 4 in (1.5 m to 1.6 m) above the floor. Use a light touch so you can make adjustments.
Lightly place the open-close magnet on the frame

Align the open-close magnet with the bottom of Contact Sensor. Make sure the max distance between Contact Sensor and magnet is under 1.2 in (30 mm), the light would glow white when they are close together.
Make sure the door is closed
Contact Sensor\'s indicator light should glow when the magnet is close enough.
The indicator light should glow when your door is open. Tap Test the Installation to continue.
There are two ways to install your Contact Sensor,You can choose one to fit your needs.
Using double-sided tape lets you start with a light touch so you can adjust placement should need be. You can adjust pressure once you are certain placement is correct.
Using screws ensures a sturdier installation but makes it harder to adjust later on. Please confirm you have chosen the appropriate position before using screws to install.
window to test the current setup out? \nAdjust the position of Contact Sensor or magnet if it did not glow.
Lightly place Contact Sensor on the window
Placing Contact Sensor on the window allows it to sense the motion of the window opening.
Lightly place open-close magnet on the frame

Align the open-close magnet with the bottom of Contact Sensor. Make sure the max distance between Contact Sensor and the magnet is under 1.2 in (30 mm), the light would glow white when they are close together.
Make sure the window is closed.
You can check whether Contact Sensor can tell when the window is opened and closed.

Align the open-close magnet with the bottom of Contact Sensor. Make sure the max distance between Contact Sensor and the magnet is under 1.2 in (30 mm), the light would glow white when they are close together.
Open and close the door to test the current setup out.
No automation found.\nPlease add an automation first.
Local scene or automation has been disabled. Please navigate to Scene to create smart scenes.
When Cloud Service is disabled, Scene and any third-party services will become unavailable. Are you sure?
This Bot is password protected. Please go back to home page, and press the Bot icon then enter your password. Please make sure the Bot has successfully been controlled once and then set automation.
Make sure the target is at a closed state
The indicator light would glow when Contact Sensor and open-close magnet are close enough.\nThe light would go off when the they are away from each other. Tap Test the installation to continue.
After you enable the indicator light, Contact Sensor glows whenever the open/closed state changed, motion detected, or ambient brightness changed.
Are you sure you want to remove this Contact Sensor from your device list?
Are you sure you want to remove this Motion Sensor from your device list?

If you press the physical button and open the door within the amount of time you set, Contact Sensor would take this action as exiting. If you open the door from outside the room and do not press the button, Contact Sensor would take this action as entering.

If you approach Contact Sensor from up to 9.8 ft (3 m) away and open the door within the amount of time you set, Contact Sensor would take this action as exiting. If no motion is detected before you open the door from outside the room, Contact Sensor would take this action as entering.
This mode only applies to installation on a door.
Long press the button on the top of the device for 2 seconds until the indicator light starts flashing. Then tap the Next button.
Unavailable when out of your Bluetooth range.
Failed to upload, Please try again.
It is recommended to calibrate the light sensor based on the ambient brightness where it is placed. Please adjust the angle of Motion Sensor to face the light source. Then tap Next.
Please turn off the lights, close the curtain, or block any light source in your room. Then tap Calibrate.

1.Do not use Plug to supply power for your heating and life support appliances.
2.The long working time of your high-power appliances will damage Plug.

Tap the Edit icon on the top right to enter Edit Mode. Then tap a button to learn IR signal.

Unlike a TV remote, each button on an AC remote sends out a combination signal containing the status, temperature, and mode data to an AC. Using Customize, Hub Mini is able to learn the combination signal and save it into a virtual button. You must set the target state of the remote in the app. Then you can send a signal to Hub Mini using your physical remote for it to record that signal.
The following example shows you how to configure the \"ON\" button in the app to learn \"turning on the AC at 20℃ and Cool mode\".
Step 1 On your physical remote, set the mode to “Cool” and the temperature to 21°C. If its temperature step is 0.5°C, you may set it to 20.5°C.
Step 2 Resume to your app. Tap the “ON” button and you will be prompted with a control panel. Now set the temperature to 20℃ and the mode to “Cool”. Tap “Continue” when you finish.
Step 3 Point your physical remote towards Hub Mini and press the temperature down button once. The physical remote will actually send out a signal to turn on the AC at 20℃ and Cool mode.
Step 4 After the signal is learned, the “ON” button will turn into solid white. Each time you tap it, it will turn on the AC at 20℃ and Cool mode.
Tap the “OFF” button in the app. Then Point your physical remote towards Hub Mini and press the power off* button once. After the signal is learned, the “OFF” button will turn into solid white.
* There may be a single power button or two separate “ON” and “OFF” buttons on the physical remote. In either cases, you must ensure a “turn off” signal is sent to Hub Mini.
AC remotes added using Customize currently supports “ON” and “OFF” voice commands when using Alexa, Google Assistant, and etc.
Before using Customize to add a remote control, please read the following notes:
For remote control added using Customize, you can tap any button to start learning the IR signal for it in Edit Mode.
After a new remote control is created, preset buttons do not contain any IR signal data. After you learn the signal for a button, it will turn into solid white.
You can re-learn the IR signal for a button as many times as you need.
Remote controls that are created under the Others category and custom buttons currently do not work with third-party services such as Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, and etc.
Before adding a remote control under the Others category, please read the following notes

How to distinguish between IR and Bluetooth remote control?
Usually you can find an IR diode or plastic filter in front of the remote and you need to point it to the appliance to control.
There is no diode or filter in front of the remote but you need to pair it with the appliance. You can often find a Bluetooth icon on the remote control.
Remote controls that are created under the Others category and custom buttons currently do not work with third-party services such as Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, and etc.

You need to set the final status, temperature, mode on the App panel first, then press the button on your original remote to send the corresponding command.

Each infrared command of an air conditioner remote includes on/off status, temperature, mode (Heat/Cool/Dry/Auto) of the target device. So you cannot do button learning individually like learning TV, light etc.. To customize an air conditioner remote, you need to set the final status, temperature and mode in the App panel first, then press the button on your original remote to send the corresponding command.
For example, to learn the \'ON\' status, cool mode and 20°C.
1) On your original remote, set the mode to cool and the temperature to 21°C. (If its temperature step is 0.5°C, you may set to \'20.5°C\'.)
2) On the App panel, tap ‘ON’ to start learning then set to ‘Cool’ mode and 20°C in the pop-up window.
3) Direct your original remote to the Hub Plus and press the temperature down button. The command sent out includes ‘ON’, ‘20°C’ and ‘COOL’.
4) The learning is done when the ‘ON’ button in the App panel turns blue.
Congratulations. Each time you press this \'ON\' button on the App panel it will set your air conditioner to cool mode at 20°C.

To learn the \"OFF\" command, just tap the \"OFF\" button on the App panel then press the \"OFF\" button on your original remote to learn. If there is a power button named \"ON/OFF\" on the remote, please press the power button when the air conditioner is on (in this scenario it will turn off your target device) to learn the \"OFF\" button on the App panel.

Please note the Alexa/Google Home integration of a customized air conditioner only supports \"ON\" and \"OFF\" commands currently. To add more functions, please let us know the brand and model number of your air conditioner by sending an email to support@wondertechlabs.com. Thanks.
Please make sure the appliance response properly.

Tapping the "Connect" button takes you to the IFTTT App, where you can link your SwitchBot to IFTTT service. You may be prompted to log in or create an IFTTT account first. Then create a new Applet and select SwitchBot as THIS or THATservice.
"Tapping the \"Connect\" button takes you to the LINE Clova App where you can connect your SwitchBot products to LINE Clova. You may be prompted to log in or create a LINE account first."

Download the SwitchBot app on App Store or Google Play Store.
Open SwitchBot app and register for a SwitchBot account or sign in directly if you have an account.
(Optional) If you need to control SwitchBot Lock remotely, receive notifications or use third-party services, you must first set up SwitchBot Hub Mini.
Cross head screwdriver (included in the package).

Before installing SwitchBot Lock, please make sure that the surface for installation is free from dirt and dust, or this may weaken the stickiness of the lock and increase the chance of falling later.
Use the wet wipe provided in the package or a cloth with neutral detergent to clean the installation area on your door.
1. Choose the thumbturn adaptor of the appropriate size.
The package provides thumbturn adaptor in 3 different sizes and one of them has already been installed on SwitchBot Lock.
Install the thumbturn adaptor of the right size onto the main body of the SwitchBot Lock. You should be able to hear a click when it is firmly installed.
2. Confirm the place of installation and direction of the SwitchBot Lock.
Confirm the following based on the position of your lock and handle:
- Sufficient space near the thumbturn for installing the back of SwitchBot Lock\'s main body stand.
- SwitchBot Lock does not affect the use of the door handle.
3. Adjust the height of SwitchBot Lock
You can match the height of your thumbturn by adjusting the main body stand.
Open the battery case cover, use the cross head screwdriver to unscrew the screws on the stand, pull the stand outwards to change the height.
Congratulations! You have completed SwitchBot Lock\'s installation.

Put the main body stand next to your door, don\'t remove the protective layer of the double sided tape yet. For smooth operation, keep a 1 to 2 mm gap between the inside of the thumbturn adaptor and the thumbturn. The thumbturn adaptor should cover more than half the depth of the thumbturn.
Hold SwitchBot Lock firmly, turn the thumbturn and check if you can lock and unlock your door smoothly.
Once confirmed with the appropriate height of the stand, screw all the screws and close the battery case cover.
Attention: Please make sure that the surface for installation is free from dirt and dust. Or this may weaken the stickiness of the lock and increase the chance of falling later.
Peel off the double sided tape on the alignment card, put it on the installation position as confirmed earlier facing the door, the alignment lines should align to the center of the thumbturn.
4. Install SwitchBot Lock on your door
Attention: Please make sure that the surface for installation is free from dirt and dust. Or this may weaken the stickiness of the lock and increase the chance of falling later.
Remove the double sided tape on the main body stand, align the center of the adaptor to the thumbturn\'s axis and install it on the door as before.
The axes of different adaptors may differ, please try to align them as precisely as you can.
After installing the main body of SwitchBot Lock, you must remove the fixing tape on the side of the adaptor.
Push SwitchBot Lock\'s main body against the door for at least 2 minutes.
Please check if there is something in the way of the deadbolt and try again.
If the door is not unlocked, please try unlocking anti-clockwise.
If you delete the device, SwitchBot Lock will resume to its factory settings and all logs will be removed. Are you sure?
Turn on this function to get confirmation every time you unlock your door remotely while you are away from home.
Remote Unlock Notification is only available when Lock is connected to SwitchBot Hub and when Cloud Services is turned on.
If the door is not locked after a certain amount of time, Lock will alert you by making a warning sound.
When the battery level is critical (≤20%), you will get notifications every 12 hours until you replace batteries.
Unlock when you get closer to SwitchBot Tag
Please check if there is something in the way of the deadbolt and try again. If you still can\'t unlock/lock, please

Install the magnet based on where you installed your Lock according to the picture. We recommend that the horizontal distance between Lock and the magnet to be less than 30 mm (about 1.2 in). Peel off the double sided protective tape on the back of the magnet, stick it on the doorframe and press it for at least 60 seconds.
Open the door and lock it manually. Push the door so that it is right next to the doorframe and tap Next at the same time.
Leave a gap, tap Test to unlock and SwitchBot Lock will unlock.
Close the door and tap Test to lock and SwitchBot Lock will lock.
When the battery level drops below 20%, Auto-Lock will be disabled. Please replace the batteries as soon as possible.
The battery level is now under 20%, Auto-Lock is disabled. Please replace the batteries as soon as possible.
If your door has been unlocked but it hasn\'t been opened, it will re-lock after the specified time.
What\'s PIN for: When you unlock using Google Assistant, it will ask for this PIN for confirmation. This avoids strangers unlocking using Google Assistant.
"Your PIN is saved on Google Home, this PIN will only be shown once. If you forget your PIN, you can reset it anytime. "

Press and hold the Power Key and Timer Key until the Wi-Fi indicator flashes. After a beep, unplug the power adapter by hands, and wait for 15 seconds before plug in again. A long beep after plugging in means the reset is done.

A factory reset is required if:\n1) Your smartphone is not available to disable the safety lock.\n2) The Fan does not work and sends out jam (locked rotor) alarm. In this case, please power off the Fan, then inspect and clean the blades before resetting. If the reset does not work, please reach us at support@wondertechlabs.com.

When SwitchBot Lock cannot be unlocked normally, Emergency Unlock can be used to help you try unlock your door. Click the button above, your lock rotor will turn clockwise to the point where it cannot go any further to try to unlock. Should this fail to unlock, click again and your lock will turn counterclockwise the same way to try to unlock.
Emergency Unlock function will clear calibration information of the Lock. Sure to use Emergency Unlock?
Please go to the Settings page of the Lock to recalibrate it in time after Emergency Unlock.
Make sure that your smartphone has Bluetooth turned on, put your mobile phone close to your device, and try again.

Install on the front of door frame
If your door is aligned with the door frame when closed
Install on the side of door frame
If your door frame is higher than the door when closed
Please keep the front of Contact Sensor and the magnet facing the same direction
We recommend you install Contact Sensor and the magnet at a height between 1.5m to 1.6m from the ground

1. Remove the tape liner on the back of the magnet and place it on your door frame gently so you can adjust placement later on.\n\n2. Stick Contact Sensor on your door with its bottom aligned with that of magnet and the gap between two objects less than 30mm wide.

1. Stick the spare double-sided tape on the side of the magnet.\n2. With the magnet stuck to your door frame by its side, the back of the magnet should be less than 5 mm away from the door to ensure Contact Sensor functions correctly. Once you have determined the installation position, please stick the magnet to the door frame gently for later adjustment.
Stick Contact Sensor on your door with its bottom aligned with that of magnet and the gap between two objects less than 30mm wide.
